runs.comm: begins with a loosener down the leg side which the batsman fails to get away as this brushes the pad before continuing behind square
needs to get his radar set as he slips one more down leg
content to shoulder arms to this one bowled on a good length outside off
shortish length which climbs appreciably upon hitting the deck. Left alone by the batsman
better line and length there as he continues to plug away in that corridor of uncertainty, with Raza having a go halfheartedly at it
pitches this up a bit on the same channel as he may have just found the ideal length for this wicket. Raza looked to get forward before withdrawing the blade a touch
too short from Vernon and given the treatment as this is pulled away fiercely through cow corner to bring up the first boundary for Zimbabwe
starts with a fuller length delivery just outside off which is met with the full face as this is driven past the bowler to the straight boundary for four
short of a length and punched away, but straight to the fielder at point
ramps the quickie through third man to beat said fielder with a one-bounce four. All valuable runs here for Zimbabwe

overpitched and on the pads as this is clipped away competently through backward square leg. Vernon, on the boundary edge, puts in the dive, but can't stop it from hitting the rope despite getting a hand on it
on the money from Morkel as Chamu is late on this full delivery outside of off, with the keeper collecting the take behind
happy to withdraw all limbs as this screams by outside off
back of a length and bunted away towards the cover fielder as they steal a single
fuller one which shapes away as Chamu shoulders arms
tries to force one through the covers but ends up mishitting towards the direction of the bowler in his follow through

tries to drill one past the bowler, but Vernon is equal to it as he picks up the return before firing in a reflex throw at the stumps, which he misses, but intimidates the batsman to get back into his crease
another one slanting down the leg side as the umpire stretches his arms
met with a slightly angled face as this is softly fended to the off side
on the pads now as Vernon goes for a shout after this struck the leg pad, but this looked like it was too high and going down leg anyways to cause any incident
covers the line of this length delivery on and around off

blasted away through the covers on the up as they pick up the four runs they so badly need to keep abreast of this required rate. No hesitation to keep this down as he threw everything at this to find the extra-cover rope
slants one in on a middle to leg line which is penalised by the umpire
manages to induce a thick outside edge which flies wide to the fielder at third man
slipping down leg as Raza, looking to hit it more towards midwicket, ends up mishitting towards mid-on
nicely behind the line of this one angling in on the pads
play-and-miss outside his off stump to this shortish length which gets good carry off the deck as it passed through to de Kock
just short of a good length and outside off, Chibhabha gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
punched past the bowler, but only to find mid-off soon after

sends one smacking into the helmet of Chamu as this one pings him straight on as he looked to duck away from the steepler, with this one going off the helmet and behind to the fine leg boundary. Looked very indecisive
flicked away now behind square to get Raza on strike
Raza ready to throw caution to the wind as he advances down the track in a hope to slice over the covers, but makes sweet connection with thin air
slow bouncer which Raza sees early before deciding to weave out of its path as it carried through to the keeper
strides forward before defending this length delivery to the off side
keeps the gap between bat and pad closed as this one angles in on middle and off
squares him up with a short of a length which bounces higher than he expected as this hits the splice to bobble over to the off side, but thankfully safe from any danger
clipped away now towards midwicket, but can't find the vacant area
delivers a yorker on a middle to leg line which has Chamu getting under it this time
content to get under another one which bounces overhead as the over comes to a close
withdraws his blade to this fuller one steaming past off stump

and Philander gets things going for South Africa with a length delivery on a tighter line closer to off stump as Raza ends up chopping this one onto the stumps, with his feet rooted in place. Raza's brief stint comes to a close
short ball outside off which is wisely left alone by Hamilton
oh dear, oh dear where is the discipline? slips one down leg as the umpire signals to the scorer
better now as he shifts the line of attack outside off, with Hamilton edging this away through third man
has a flash at this just back of a length outside his off stump, with some shape away from the batsman
fuller now in the same channel as this is drilled straight to mid-off, with the pair scampering through for the single
not quite got a lock on proceedings as he strays down leg, with this brushing the thigh guard before continuing through to the fine leg boundary
better now as he delivers a short of a length ball outside off which is punched away towards the covers
gets good shape away as this one is delivered in the same channel on a slightly fuller length, with Chamu steering this past point to find the boundary. Rare blunder in the field from SA
nibbles one away on a length just outside off as Chamu plays devilishly close to the line
nicely behind the line of this one swinging away as this one is punched straight to silly mid-off
length ball angling down the pads as all Chamu has to do is get a tickle on it as this flies wide of short backward square to find the rope
solid defensive shot on the front foot as this one is sent to the cover fielder
able to glide away this length delivery outside off to third man
short from the bowler, and outside off, as the third umpire signals one for the over
tucked away off the back foot towards mid-on as they scurry for the tight single
slanting down the pads as this is tapped away on the leg side by the batsman. Brings up the fifty as well for Zimbabwe
tries to guide one past the point fielder, but this time the fielder is equal to the task after putting in a dive
length wide of off which shapes away on the way to the keeper
tries to dab this one past Faf at point, but no dice
short and Hamilton opts for the pull through long on, but is cut off by a wonderful dive at mid-on
this time Chamu gets the length for the pull as he strokes this comfortably away over cow corner
clipped away off the pads now to get to the other end
gets behind the line of this length delivery as the over comes to a close
starts with a fuller length ball which is steered to the leg side by the batsman
Hamilton plants the food to try and drill this through cover, but is stopped by the short cover fielder
this time forces it away off the back foot to get the single
full and straying on the pads as this is clipped away behind square
hits this one uppishly back in the direction of the bowler, but powered it enough so that Farhaan couldn't even get a mitt on it
gets the line wrong as he drifts down leg
short outside off and scythed away through the covers
slices away Steyn through third man as the fielder is brought into play
shorter one which Hamilton goes after, pulling this uppishly over midwicket before landing safe in the end
another one which is sliced away outside off as third man fields the ball before the boundary
defended away from the confines of his crease
hangs on the back foot before bunting this away towards the off side
straddles down middle and leg as Hamilton fails to get this away through the leg side
is late on this one angling in on middle and leg as it strikes him on the thigh pad
fuller one which is struck towards the mid-on fielder
floats one in outside off which is drilled straight to mid-off
looking to up the ante as he lifts Farhaan over the covers, but doesn't get enough on it to reach the boundary rope
fullish length which is nurdled towards mid-on, who has a shy at the non-striker's stumps
short, half-trekker which Farhaan drags as this is pulled efficiently through midwicket for four
floated up on middle stump line, Masakadza bunts it back to the bowler
continues round the wicket as Hamilton looks to be adventurous as he attempts a reverse sweep
this time clipped away to the leg side
gets this one to spin in after pitching outside leg
punches this off the back foot, but straight to the cover fielder
leans forward before turning this to the leg side with deft hands
play-and-miss outside off to this short of a length which carries nicely off the deck
Mt Masakadza pulls this shortish length powerfully through midwicket to bring up a boundary
now picks the gap at point to smash away this fullish length outside of off. This one just streaked away off the surface
gets the bat down to this fuller length on the same channel
runs this one outside off down to third man for one
fuller now and nibbling in a touch as this is defended on the front foot
continues round the wicket as Hamilton picks his spot at long off before clubbing JP over the region to bring up four runs
shows his more innovative side with a deft reverse sweep pulled off to perfection as the ball gets past the close-in fielder on the ring
darts one in across the big right-hander as he picks up a single with a push to long off
backs away to create room before striking this one back to JP
this time glances away to the leg side, but can't pinch the single
fuller now as he needles a run through midwicket
opens the face to glide this down to third man
goes for the good ole tap-and-run outside off as Chamu makes it to the danger end with an ungainly dive
length on and around off which is tucked away to the leg side
tries again for the tap-and-run, but hits it a bit too straight to the fielder at point
searching for the yorker as he sees Hamilton back away, so he follows him with this inswinging delivery. Good cricket all around as Hamilton digs this one out
slower one outside off which Hamilton almost drags on, but is lucky as the ball continues through towards backward square
begins with a low full toss down the leg side which is clipped away
eased away on the front foot to long on
drilled firmly to the man at mid-off, who gets safely behind the ball
struck away past a sprawling mid-off as they cross for the single
shows his variation with a quicker one which the batsman is late on as he is struck on the pads, but this looked like it was slipping down leg
bowls a wrong'un this time which the batsman has no idea off
tries to get this one past the close-in field on the leg side, but this is South Africa, so just no

hangs on the back foot before tucking this one away with deft hands to bring up a 10th ODI fifty. Has been a wonderful effort from the right-hander, but his team will need him to press on to bigger and better things
employs the sweep to good effect as the ball is fielded just before the backward square boundary
punched away off the back foot towards the leg side
this time content to drive down to long off to bring up the Zimbabwe 100
slapped away outside off to sweeper cover
defended away to the leg side
driven down towards the bowler now, who puts in a dive
Hamilton finds the single as he pierces the vacant space at long off

Tahir thinks he may have got his man as he utters a loud appeal, with AB and him deciding whether to pursue the review, before the former decided against it. This one struck after turning on the thigh guard, but it may have just been going down leg
struggling to pick Tahir at the moment as this one spins away now
gets this to turn in after drifting on off, with the ball clipped away to the leg side
Hamilton sends Farhaan out of the oval with a huge bludgeon over cow corner, with this one going high up in the air before carrying enough to get over the boundary
this time gives himself room to cut away fiercely through point

smart batting from Hamilton as he notices fine leg is inside the circle. Ends up paddling this one heading down the leg side over his shoulder to find yet another boundary. Has constructed his innings beautifully thus far
content to just steer this fuller one down to long on
struck away to the off side, but can't pierce the gap
finishes it off with a fuller delivery which is helped down to long on by the batsman
shimmies down a touch before easing this away through to deep midwicket
floats one outside off which spins away sharply as Hamilton works with it to cut it away
defended on the front foot from the relative safely of his crease
steers Tahir through long on to get to the other end
turned away now to the leg side as they cross over
did this carry? Chamu pushes at this one uppishly in the direction of Tahir, but this may have died on the way to the spinner as he dove forward to try and snaffle the chance
begins with a fullish delivery outside off which is driven back to him at a rate of knots
how audacious was this? Hamilton steps down and then proceeds to thwack Steyn over the covers as though he was some mere club bowler. Fantastic shot to bring up his fifty
sensibly gets away a single on the leg side to this length delivery on the hips
content to let this one fly through to de Kock
delivers a length delivery wide of off which is struck powerfully on the up through the covers, with short cover putting in a dive to his right in vain
short and pounced upon by Chamu, but is unlucky to locate the deep midwicket fielder on the bounce
tries to pull this one slipping down leg, but is late on the ball. Doesn't matter as a wide is called anyways
gets down the track as he picks his spot at cow corner, and finds it with aplomb with a delightful chip in the region
eased away off the toes towards the leg side
almost succeeds in chopping one onto the stumps as this streaks away through backward square. Partnership over a 100 by the way
tries to send this one careening through the covers, but ends up dragging the stroke towards the bowler
dances down before adjusting to try and place this past square-leg, but to no avail as the fielder picks up the ball to fire in a throw at the keeper's end

and Tahir makes the crucial breakthrough for South Africa as Chamu departs the oval after mishitting a slice over extra-cover, with this one dying just before the rope where the fielder was staioned. JP is able to keep himself within the playing field and take this. Ends a spirited knock from the Zimbabwean opener
short outside off which is allowed to go through to the keeper
defended away towards the off side
short and given the treatment as Hamilton pulls this authoritatively through cow corner
short again and slanting down leg as Hamilton, who is not quite in control, hooks this away to backward square, with the fielder at deep fine leg unable to get around to it
simply opens the face to run this one down to third man
shoulders arms to this length delivery which climbs as it reaches the keeper
eased away to the leg side by the batsman
plays just outside the line of this as the ball grabs the inside-edge to go behind square
punched away now off the back foot to long on
elegant from Taylor as he lifts Tahir over the covers, and with no one in the deep on the off side, ends up being a viable option
squares him up a touch as this one turns in after pitching on and around leg on a fuller length
defended away to the leg side by the batsman
expertly ramps the fast bowler over third man, but can't get it away to the boundary as Steyn shows wonderful commitment in the position to dive and cut this off before the rope
fended away on the front foot as they scamper for the quick single
fullish length which is edged away towards backward point
gets nicely behind the line to cover for any deviation
overpitched and dispatched down the ground by Taylor for a one-bounce four
steered away now on the front foot to third man
turned away to the leg side for one
delivers this one well down the leg side
brushed away off the pads towards the general vicinity of midwicket
able to clip this away off the hips as they continue to rotate strike
drives the spinner down to long on for a sedate run
content to just defend this to the leg side
goes for the sweep as he picks out Morkel at short backward square
looks to ramp this slow bouncer, but is late on the ball
this time pitches it up, with this one called one for the over after Hamilton failed to paddle this over fine leg despite going down on one knee
driven straight to the bowler in his follow through
looks for the dab down to third man
ramps this shorter one from Philander over to the fielder at third man
pulls this short ball away to deep midwicket to bring the over to a end
crashed away off the back foot to the man at long on
flicked away now behind square as they cross ends
called a wide as he fails to paddle-sweep this past the keeper and down fine leg
nurdled away off the back foot as they complete a straightforward single
reaches out to meet this one before the ball spun away to brush the thigh guard
executed the paddle sweep round the corner with ease as the quicker, flatter trajectory helped Taylor get this away in the gap
helps himself to single down to deep midwicket
just can't get this one drifting in on middle and off away
offers up a low full toss which is clubbed away to deep midwicket
this time goes for the paddle sweep which has de Kock racing after it, but this one lands safely at backward square
this time guided away to the cover fielder
punched off the back foot towards the mid-off fielder, who picks up and fires in a throw on the fly at the non-strikers, which challenges the batsman to make his ground. You don't mess with AB

de Kock able to whip off the bails to this one which spins away from Hamiton as he looked to slam this out of the ground. The umpire is unsure if Hamilton got his foot back over the line when the bails were disturbed, but the third umpire confirms the decision soon after
driven off the back foot down to long on
this time whipped away off the pads for one
meets this one with a full face as the ball falls away to the leg side
this time threads the gap at long on to get to the other end

drags this one a bit but this has to be Hamilton's day, and why not since the city is named the same. Able to slug away the spinner over midwicket, with the fielder near the boundary unable to catch this one before the rope
and another one goes to ground as JP is left scratching his head. This time Hamiton looks to slice over cover, getting this high over backward point, but landing safe in the end
darts in a quicker one which is helped down to long on
waits on the front foot before covering for the turn
this time squares him up with the wrong'un as the ball is hit towards the off side

dropped another one hit towards the bowler today, except this time it carried, as Tahir, more for self-preservation then anything else, is unable to get any fingers on it as it is struck straight back at him at stomach-height
bunts this one down to mid-on and gets to the other end

Tahir has landed the big one as he removes Hamilton with one which turns away as the batsman looked to get it away through midwicket before offering a leading edge which spoons harmlessly to Amla at cover, who takes it with glee. Leaves the oval with 80 to his name, and it really has been an inspired knock under pressure
eases away Duminy through long on for one
driven firmly by Sean towards the covers as he gets off the mark
bunted away to the leg side as he searches for the vacant space
just about fends away this one which spins in from outside off
nurdles a single through the leg side to get Williams on strike
sends this one straight to the mid-off fielder to end the over
goes for the tap-and-run outside off which they execute to perfection
defended by the batsman

looks like he may have been struck in line as he looks to punch this away. There is a momentary delay as Sean is unsure whether he will be given, but Taylor wants the run as he crosses over the other end. SA want to review this though. Looks like it might be a little high, with no contact made with the bat as per Snicko. The decision comes down and they rule the lbw not out, but hold on, now they are checking for the run-out, but he looks like he may have made his ground anyways, so all is well that ends well I suppose
takes this length delivery outside off and deposits it over cow corner with a powerful blow. 200 up for Zimbabwe
backs away to the leg side before going for the percentage strike down long off to pickup a one-bounce four
looks for the gap at fine leg as Taylor ends up paddling this over in that region, but not where he would have liked it
begins with a fullish length outside off which is driven towards cover
gets this to nibble in from a middle and off line as Sean is a touch late on it as the ball gets inside-edged onto his pads
in the slot and Williams shows his class with a lovely drive on the up as this one just raced away across the turf
length delivery on a wider line as Williams looks imploringly to the umpire for any kind of sympathy
short and pulled powerfully to deep midwicket by Williams
able to get away this shorter one on the leg side for a single

and the drinks break claims yet another victim as Taylor has to go now with a halfhearted slog to this slower delivery on middle and leg. Taylor goes for a well-played 40 as this chase threatens to get away from them
tries to steer this one past backward point, but this is South Africa! so yeah, nothing comes out of it
looks for the chip down long on to this slow ball on middle and leg
another slow ball from Morne which does the trick, with this one striking high on the bat to pop up over mid-off, but away from any fielders
gets away a pull through midwicket as they complete a brace
lets go off the handle as he fails to get this pull away through the leg side to this slow bouncer from Morks
continues round the wicket as this is fended to the off side
eases the spinner to mid-on as he gets himself to the other end and out of the hot seat
looks to get down the track before playing this one back at the bowler
top-edge which goes straight up in the air as the keeper calls this one before completing the catch safely. Really didn't go anywhere at all. Looks like the pressure is starting to get to them now
nudges this one away square off the wicket on the leg side
helped down to long on to bring this successful over for SA to a close
manages to pickup a single through gully
short and looking to hook this over backward square, but is late on it
brings the bat down to this short of a length going across him
fullish length on the pads as Ervine fails to clip this away
glanced away now behind square as they cross over for the single
short outside off and just swatted across the line over extra-cover. Unbelievable blow from the Zimbabwe captain, truly against the run of play as he stood and delivered
advances down before working this away just behind square to the close-in fielder
strikes the pad on his front leg as he plays down the wrong line. Duminy likes it as he appeals to the umpire, but not given
tries to force one away on the up through cover, but to no avail
flatter delivery on middle and off which is defended back to the bowler
content to just drive this one back to Duminy
decides he has to go with a wristy flick over midwicket which goes the distance. Easy as you like from Ervine
looking for the yorker as this full delivery is lasered to the cover fielder
strikes him on the toe with this full delivery, but was definitely heading down leg, despite the mild interest from the bowler
just eased away off the back foot through the off side as they scurry a quick single
sees the batsman backing away so he delivers a slightly wide yorker which Elton is unable to get at

searching for the blockhole now as he lets go of a low full toss which is clipped away behind square, with AB pouncing on this at mid-off to fire in a throw at the striker's end, with the batsman short of his ground as he veered away in his attempt to ground the bat. You just can't take on AB's rocket arm
fails to get away this pull as they end up running the leg bye regardless
gets this one to spin away as this is placed on the off side for one
gets this one to drift in and spin sharply on the batsman, who plays all around it
this is the straighter one which is fended away on the front foot
almost gets Mire to chop on as he floats in another wrong'un which the batsman fails to pick as he looks for the short-arm pull
once again drags the stroke as he fails to pick Tahir's variation
this time works with the spin away from him to get deep and punch this straight to mid-off
gets an inside-edge to this slower, length delivery from Steyn, with the ball streaking away behind on the leg side
full and on the money as this is dug out by the batsman
reaches out to this slightly wide delivery outside off, with the result being a drive at the cover fielder
goes for the pull to this shorter one as midwicket comes into play
slow ball going across the batsman as he opts for the offcutter, which the batsman is not even in the same time zone of
short ball which rushes on Ervine as he ends up offering a simple top-edge chance to mid-on, who snaps it up gleefully. Ervine has to go and Zimbabwe in the doldrums now at 240 for 7
able to drive this one to the cover point fielder
covers for the turn as he presents a dead, straight bat to Tahir
slips in his conventional leggie which Tinasha connects with as he goes for the lofted sweep through cow corner, which he gets away in the end despite the man in the deep
bowls a lovely googly which turns sharply into Tinashe's pads

AB pulls off another special catch in the ring as Tahir claims yet another at Seddon Park, getting Tinashe to provide a leading edge to this attempted sweep, with AB running full tilt from backward square to complete the take
spoons a chance uppishly through long on, but with no in the vicinity, turns out to be a safe option
bang on target as Mire somehow manages to dig this yorker on middle out, with the ball continuing on through third man

Mire will probably not forget that one in a while. He only manages to take on one of the best in the world with a lovely flick behind square which sails all the way over the boundary rope. Steyn will be livid
and manages to dig out another yorker haring on off stump. Seems only a matter of time though...
this time opts for the slower bouncer as he sees Mire hanging back in his crease in preparation for the yorker
overpitched outside off as Steyn gets this slightly wrong, with the drive from Mire having enough legs on it to beat the cover and mid-off fielder to the boundary
sensational hitting from Steyn as his horror match continues. Mire just picks his spot before punishing Steyn with a blow through long off
goes up for a loud, raucous appeal as he strikes the pads, but this might have been slipping down leg
goes for the conventional leggie as Tendai fails to glide this one away through third man
looks for the big heave down the ground which goes straight up, but this falls safe as there are no fielders stationed between long off and mid-off
driven back to the bowler as he covers for the spin
clubs yet another one with the spin to deep midwicket, but can't get it either side of him on the boundary rope
gets through the final ball as Tahir wraps up a tidy spell of 3 for 36

that just might be the biggest six of the tournament as Mire showcases his IPL credentials with a huge scythe over cow corner that just flew high over the stand. This may have even departed the oval. Tremendous strike from the Zimbabwean!
goes for another big heave down the ground to this widish, full delivery outside off
ends up going too fast through his stroke to this bouncer on middle and off
yet another play-and-a-miss as the ball is saved from another demoralising strike from Mire's blade
wide of the crease and Morkel won't get away it as the umpire goes through the motions
fullish length outside off which he fails to get any bat on as Morkel has found the right channel to get through these final death overs
overpitched and thundered down the ground by MIre, but is cut off by a dive from the long on fielder

AB pops up again in the deep as Philander has got them just one away now as Mire, looking to smash every remaining delivery out of the park, ends up pulling this towards de Villiers at deep midwicket, who puts in a wonderful forward dive to catch him in the deep. Ends a very entertaining cameo from Mire. Will be great to see more pyrotechnics from him as this tournament wages on
reaches out to this fuller length, almost inside-edging this as it continues on to the keeper
searching for the yorker as he ends up giving up a low full toss which is struck back to him. The batsmen run the single as Philander turns to fire in a throw at the non-striker's, but misses
low full toss which is in the slot as this is blazed away through the covers for a boundary
is well late on this bouncer outside off which Tendai fails to ramp over third man
able to cart away this fuller delivery on and around off to the mid-on fielder
advances down the track before realising this is an attempted wide yorker, so tries to readjust to get at it, but fails to do so
and with a simple return chance to this full delivery on middle, Morkel has snapped up the final scalp to give South Africa a 62-run victory in the end
